intro: Dicoria clarkiae, commonly known as Clark's dicoria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. It is often found in alpine meadows and has adapted to cold, harsh climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
